cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with linear codes, which are commonly studied in information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of Gauss sums is also a common technique in coding theory and cryptography, which further supports the relevance to these sub-categories. The paper also mentions the potential applications of the linear codes in secret sharing schemes, authentication codes, and data storage systems, which fall under the sub-categories of distributed systems (cs.DS), computational complexity (cs.CC), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
